title: Lost a font - only in Quark
content:
Hey Folks,

Maybe this is rudimentary, but it certainly has me stumped!

I’ve got a much-loved font simply called DIN and it functions perfectly in Illus, but not Quark. As soon as I upgraded my Q 6.1 to 6.5, documents with DIN Light open with errors in locating that font.

I’ve tested the font in Illus with no problem.

I tried reloading the font and that didn’t get me anywhere either.

What gives? I’m stumped.

Thanks for any tips.

.a

 [‹ Crossfont: convert Type 1 to OpenType](http://web.archive.org/web/20080324121203/http:/www.typophile.com/node/15285 "Go to previous forum topic") [Exported fonts (for PC) dont look great on paper ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080324121203/http:/www.typophile.com/node/15419 "Go to next forum topic")
author: ayleen

comments.content:
If you find anything, I’d love to know.  
We have a few customers experiencing the same thing with one of our fonts and Quark 6.5.

Are you by chance using Font Reserve?
DIN will not read in quark when it’s activated through some font managers. I have had to copy it in to my OSX user/library/fonts folder and then it works fine.
